input_text:
Job Title: Electrical Instrumentation and Controls Engineer

Location: Roswell, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Summary

Our client, a leader in the terminal and petroleum space, is seeking an experienced EI&C Engineer to add to the team in Roswell, GA. Must have a Bachelors in Electrical Engineering or similar. This position will be focused on commissioning the integration of HMI and PLC development. Must be familiar with PLC Coding (allen bradley, rockwell, GE software, emerson, fanuc) and HMI Design( Wonderware).

Must Haves

Project management experience Experience with oil and gas industry, pipeline, refinery, petrochemical highly preferred Wastewater industry preferred Knowledge of pumps, meters and pressure transmitters Setting up power stations- medium voltage- preferred- MCC's Instrumentation and controls engineering experience Hands on PLC/HMI/SCADA programming experience

Relocation assistance is available!!!

Great Benefits!!!

location: Roswell, Georgia

job type: Permanent

salary: $90,000 - 135,000 per year

work hours: 8am to 4pm

education: Bachelors

Responsibilities

Develop, design, maintain and commission a variety of control systems. Develop scopes of work, cost estimates and budgets for projects. Support, maintain, and modify existing SCADA controls centers and HMI Stations. Coordinate with internal design/drafting functions and third party support firms. Prepare bid documents and coordinates with Purchasing Department from the bidders and vendors Manage, direct, coordinate and expedite construction and maintenance projects at terminals and pipeline facilities. Create project schedules and project execution through project lifecycle Oversee and execute start-up activities of terminal, pipe, and pipeline projects Provide initial instruction for operations personnel on new and upgraded controls system equipment Ensure compliance with safety standards for all construction and maintenance projects and conducts contractor safety meetings Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards Provides operation support during system startup and troubleshooting 

Qualifications

Experience level: ExperiencedMinimum 3 years of experienceEducation: Bachelors (required)

Skills

InstrumentationElectrical EngineeringControlsMaintenancePLCSCADAHMIProject Management

Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

At Randstad, we welcome people of all abilities and want to ensure that our hiring and interview process meets the needs of all applicants. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please contact HRsupport@randstadusa.com.

Pay offered to a successful candidate will be based on several factors including the candidate's education, work experience, work location, specific job duties, certifications, etc. In addition, Randstad offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health, an incentive and recognition program, and 401K contribution (all benefits are based on eligibility).

Applications accepted on ongoing basis until filled.

Experience Level (if available): None
